alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Montgomery (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 7:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: .Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line over Davidson, Randolph, and Montgomery counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson, Montgomery and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... High Point, Asheboro, Lexington, Randleman, Badin Lake, North Carolina Zoo, Thomasville, Seagrove, Linwood, Badin, Ramseur, Denton, Franklinville, Martha, Gordontown, Ulah, Pinehaven Marina, Whip-O-Will Campground, Fish Tales Marina and High Rock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
